intro: Hypericum hircinum var. obtusifolium, commonly known as the blunt-leaved St. John's wort, is a variant of the St. John's wort species native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves with rounded tips, which distinguish it from other varieties. The plant produces small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer, typically from June to August. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in grassy areas and woodland edges. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been historically used in herbal remedies.
